snippet: The Indiana State Department of Health said Friday that there are 120 confirmed H.I.V. cases tied to a county that began a needle exchange program two weeks ago.
abstract: Indiana health officials report significant increase in HIV cases in Scott County over short period of time, with number of confirmed cases rising from 106 to 120 in one week; officials say they expect number to rise as more people are tested in midst of outbreak tied to drug use; growing number of cases could pressure Gov Mike Pence to extend temporary 30-day needle exchange program.
lead_paragraph: The Indiana State Department of Health said Friday that there are 120 confirmed H.I.V. cases tied to a county that began a needle exchange program two weeks ago.

headline.main: Indiana Says H.I.V. Outbreak Is Worsening
headline.print_headline: Indiana Says H.I.V. Outbreak Has Worsened
